--- Ra_Intro_01_01 ---
The purpose of this demo is to teach you how to create a personal auto submission. This is a modified version of the demonstration from the Policy Center Introduction course. If you already know how to create a personal auto submission, you may skip this demo. To create a personal auto submission in the base application, you need to start from a personal account, for example, Ray Newton. Click the down arrow next to search. Next, click Accounts. This is the Search Accounts screen. Click the First Name field. Type, Ray, into the First Name field. Click the Last Name field. Type, Newton, into the Last Name field. Click the Search button. Click the Account Number link for Ray Newton. This is the Account screen for Ray Newton. Next, we'll see how to create a personal auto submission. Click Actions. Click Actions. Click New Submission. This is the New Submission screen. The Organization, Producer Code, Quote Type, State, and Effective Date fields have default values. For the purposes of this demo, none of these need to be changed. We want to create a personal auto submission, so click the Select button next to Personal Auto. The first step is to select an Offerive. In Policy Center, an offering allows us to provide default coverages and it also can be used in Rating. Click the Offering Selection field. Select Basic Program. Click the Next button to move to the next step in the submission. This is the Policy Info screen. This is the Qualification screen. This screen asks a few questions to determine if the submission should proceed. For the purposes of this demo, we only need to select an answer for the first question. To do this, click the field next to the question, Is the Applicant Currently Insured? Select, Yes. Click the Next button to move to the next step in the submission. This is the Policy Info screen. Note the effective date of this policy. This will be used by the Rating Engine to select the correct rate book. Click the Next button to move to the next step in the submission. Here is the driver's screen. Click the Down arrow next to the Add button to add a driver. Click on Ray Newton in the existing driver. Now we can see the details of our driver Ray Newton. Nothing else needs to be changed on this screen. Click Next to move to the next step in the submission. The Vehicles screen is where a specific vehicle or vehicles to be insured are added. Click the Create Vehicle button. Click the VIN field. Click the VIN field. Type, 2 in the VIN field. Click the License Date field. Select California. Click the Cost New field. Type 25,000. Next, assign Ray Newton as a driver on this vehicle. Click the Down arrow next to the Add button. Click, Ray Newton. No other changes are needed on this screen. So click Next to move to the next step in this submission. Click the Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb Sabb the additional coverages tab. Click this tab. Select the rental car loss of use coverage. Click next to move to the next step in this submission. This is the risk analysis screen. If there were any underwriting issues they would be listed here. There are none, so click next to move to the next step. This is the policy review screen. This screen shows details about the submission such as the effective date and selected coverages. Click the quote button to quote this submission. This is the quote screen. Note the total premium, taxes and surcharges that were calculated by the rating engine. The next step is to issue the policy. Click the bind options button. Click issue policy. Click, ok, on the confirmation message. This completes this demo.

--- Ra_Intro_01_02 ---
The purpose of this demo is to teach you how to create a commercial property submission. This is a modified version of the demonstration from the Policy Center Introduction course. If you already know how to create a commercial property submission, you may skip this demo. To create a commercial property submission in the base application, you need to start from a commercial account, for example, write construction. Click the down arrow next to search. Next, click Accounts. Click the Company Name field. Type Write Construction into the Company Name field. Click the Search button. Write Construction happens to have two accounts in PolicyCenter. For the purposes of this demo, it doesn't matter which one we use. Click the Account Number link. This is the Account screen for write construction. Next, we'll see how to create a commercial property submission. Click Actions. Click New Submission. Click the Select button next to Commercial Property. This is the Policy Info screen. For the purposes of this demo, nothing needs to be changed. Click the Next button to move to the next step in the submission. The next step is to add a building. Click the next step is to add a building to this location. Click the Down Arrow. Click New Building. This is the New Building screen. The next step is to assign a property class code to this building. This is done via Lookup. Click the Search button. Type 0074 in the Code field. Click the Search button. There are several class code to add a search button. There are several class codes returned by this search. For the purposes of this demo, any of them may be selected. Click the Select button next to a class code. The next step is to select a coverage form. Click on the Coverage Form field. Select Building and Personal Property. The next step is to select coverages for this building. Click the Coverages tab. Unselect Business Income Coverage. Click OK to save this building. new building. This submission is ready for rating, however, first check to see if there are any underwriting issues. Click the risk analysis link. There are no underwriting issues, so click the rate button. This is the quote screen for commercial property. Note the total premium, taxes and surcharges are displayed here. No other changes are needed. Click the finish quote button. The final step is to issue the policy. Click the bind options button. Click issue policy. Click OK on the confirmation message. This completes the step.

--- Ra_Intro_02_02 ---
In this demo, I'll do a policy change transaction that will result in a change to the premium and taxes. For the purposes of this demo, I will add an additional vehicle to a personal auto policy. To start the policy change, click Actions. Click Change Policy. The next step is to enter a description for this policy change. Click the Description field. Type, Adding Vehicle into the field. Click Next to move to the next step in the Policy Change wizard. Click Vehicles to jump directly to that step of the wizard. Click the Create Vehicle button. Click the VIN field. Type 3 in the field. Click the License State field. Select California. Click the Cost New field. Type 19,000. Click the Add button. Click Ray Newton. Nothing else needs to be changed, so click Quote. This is the Quote screen for the policy change. Because a new vehicle was added to this policy. Because a new vehicle was added to this policy, the cost has increased by $640. Next, we'll look at the Cost Change Detail to get more information about what changed. Click Cost Change Detail. This tab shows specifically what costs changed during this transaction. There is additional premium and taxes. Keep in mind that this change was very simple. However, this can become more complex if there were more vehicles and changes were made to those vehicles. The next step is to issue the policy. Click the Issue Policy button. Click OK to confirm. Click the Policy link. Click Financial Transactions. This is the Financial Transactions screen. This screen has three ways to view the transactions. First is just all transactions. Next is to view the transactions by job. And finally, to view the transactions by period. Click on Transactions by Period. This is the Transactions by Period screen. Click the View by Cost link. This is the Transactions by Cost screen. On this screen we can see the details about each cost. Notice that the first set is from the submission. After scrolling down the screen, it's now possible to see that the second set of costs are from the policy change. Next, we'll look at the Transactions by Job. Click the Return to Transactions by Period button. Click the Return to Financial Transactions button. Click the Transactions by Job link. This is the Transactions by Job screen. Notice that the first set is from the submission and the second set is from the policy change. This completes this demo. 

--- Ra_Intro_03_01 ---
In the demo, we will look at the process used to export rate books to an Excel format, edit a rate table, and then import the updated rate table. Let's navigate to the rate book. Click the down arrow. Click rate books. Next, we will find the rate books for personal auto. Click the policy, line field. Select personal auto. Click the search button. We will work with the demo rating rate book. Notice that there are two editions of this rate book. Click the link for addition 2. Notice that this rate book is in an active status. This means that no changes can be made to the rate book. To change this rate book, I'll have to create a new edition. Click the Create new edition button. Click the Addition field. Type 3. The next step is to set when this rate book will become effective. Click the date lookup. Select the date when this rate book will be effective. For the purposes of this demo, I'll select the first day of the next month. Click the Update button. Notice this rate book is now in draft status. This will allow us to change the rates. I could edit the rates using the browser. However, I'm going to export the rate book and edit the rates using Excel. To do this, I'll click the export button. And then select, Export to spreadsheet. I'll download the spreadsheet by clicking the download button. And then, download spreadsheet. Now I can open the spreadsheet I downloaded in Excel. Notice that the first tab of this spreadsheet has details about this rate book. Click the tab for the base rates. Click the Base Rate field. Change the base rate to 94. Click the Save button. We now have to import the base rate change back in. To do this, return to the rate book. Click the Edit button. Select Base Rate. Click the Import button. Click the Browse button. Select the spreadsheet file. Click the Open button. Click OK. Click Update. Select the state. Let's confirm that the change imported. Click Base Rate. The base rate for that coverage is now 94. This completes this demo.  

--- Ra_intro_02_01 ---
Now, we're going to examine the costs that were created when a submission is rated. Here's a submission that was created earlier. Note the total cost on the screen, along with the total premium and taxes. Let's look at the rating worksheet. Click the Rating Worksheet button. The rating worksheet shows details about how the costs were calculated. Click the collision coverage to see how the costs for this coverage were calculated. Note that the details of this calculation are shown. The rating worksheet also shows the details of the tax calculation. Click the tax to view this information. Now, the details of the tax calculation are shown. This completes the demo.
